revised_title: Infra-red Chemiluminescence II: Spectroscopic Data Analysis
tldr: The authors used spectroscopic techniques to study the infra-red chemiluminescence of hydrogen chloride (HCl) molecules. They evaluated the vibration-rotation interaction factor (γ) and the dipole moment function, which helped in determining radiative transition probabilities. The results support earlier findings and provide insights into the behavior of molecules with similar properties.
